description: From Middle English alighten, from a merger of Old English ālīhtan (“to alight, dismount”), from prefix ā- (compare Gothic 𐌿𐍃- (us-), German er- originally meaning "out") + līhtan (“to alight”); and Old English ġelīhtan (“to alight, approach, come, come down, dismount”); equivalent to alight +‎ -en.

verbs.description: alighten (third-person singular simple present alightens, present participle alightening, simple past and past participle alightened)

entries.meaning: To alight, to dismount or get down from.
To alight; to land, to descend and rest.

description: From Middle English alighten, from a merger of Old English ālīhtan (“to lighten, relieve, alleviate, take off, take away, alight”) and Old English ġelīhtan (“to lighten, mitigate, assuage”); equivalent to a- +‎ lighten.

verbs.description: alighten (third-person singular simple present alightens, present participle alightening, simple past and past participle alightened)

entries.meaning: To lighten; to reduce in weight or heaviness.

description: From Middle English alighten, from Old English ālīhtan (“to light up, enlighten”); equivalent to a- +‎ light. Cognate with German erleuchten (“to light up, illuminate”).

verbs.description: alighten (third-person singular simple present alightens, present participle alightening, simple past and past participle alightened)

entries.meaning: To make light; to illuminate or brighten.
